pull.title: Fix several issues in the Qt unit tests.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Bitcoin (dont fork from here, fork from bitcoin/bitcoin)

events.body:
Please don't merge this yet, I'm gonna use to it test Jenkins' new pull-testing capabilities :)
(this will fail because it makes bitcoin-qt_test compatible with Jenkins' build script, and bitcoin-qt_test currently fails)

events.message:
Fix Qt test cases by moving address checks to parseBitcoinURI

Makes sense in case bitcoin URIs eventually allow invalid addresses
as a part of some larger future payment scheme.

events.body:
The following is an automatic comment from the Bitcoin Pull Tester.
If you believe it is in error, please contact jenkins@bluematt.me

This pull failed automatic sanity-tests!
This could happen for one of several reasons:
1. It chanages paths in makefile.linux-mingw or otherwise changes build scripts in a way that made them incompatible with the automated testing scripts
2. It does not merge cleanly onto current master
3. It does not build on either Linux i386 or Win32 (via MinGW cross compile)
4. The test suite fails on either Linux i386 or Win32

You can find the test log and build output at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/fdf86649e3556d475967e49368d8266e460ecb91
Well it identifies everything as invalid so far, but it should be good for the positive now...just have to keep running the several hour test each time...
